# width

**Instance Property**

The size of the list.

## Declaration

```swift
var width: ListFormatStyle<Style, Base>.Width
```

## Discussion

The `width` property controls the size of the list. The [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/ListFormatStyle/locale] determines the formatting and abbreviation of the string for the given `width`.

For example, for English:

```swift
["One", "Two", "Three"].formatted(.list(type: .and, width: .standard))
// “One, Two, and Three”

["One", "Two", "Three"].formatted(.list(type: .and, width: .short))
// “One, Two, & Three” 

["One", "Two", "Three"].formatted(.list(type: .and, width: .narrow))
// “One, Two, Three” 
```

The default value is [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/ListFormatStyle/Width-swift.enum/standard].

## Modifying a list format style

- **ListFormatStyle.Width**: The type representing the width of a list.
- **listType**: The type of the list.
- **ListFormatStyle.ListType**: A type that describes whether the returned list contains cumulative or alternative elements.
- **locale**: The locale to use when formatting items in the list.
